verbs.description: sensitize (third-person singular simple present sensitizes, present participle sensitizing, simple past and past participle sensitized)

entries.meaning: To make (someone or something) sensitive or responsive to certain stimuli.
examples: Anaphylaxis is the syndrome elicited in a hypersensitive subject upon subsequent exposure to the sensitizing antigen.

entries.meaning: To make (someone) increasingly aware of, in a concerned or sensitive way.
examples: Ever since the burglary, we've been more sensitized to home security issues.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To render capable of being acted on by actinic rays of light.
